caption.p: Airway T cells are protective against SARS-CoV challenge. (A) Survival rate of SARS-CoV infected mice after depletion of airway CD4 + T cells. n=5, rIgG i.n.; n=24, aCD4 i.n. (B) Virus titers of SARS-CoV infected mice after depletion of airway CD4 + T cells. Titers are expressed as PFU/g tissue. n=3 mice/group/time point. * P<0.05. Data are representative of two independent experiments. (C) Survival rate of SARS-CoV infected mice after depletion of airway CD8 + T cells. n=5, rIgG i.p.; n=7, aCD8 i.p. (D) Virus titers of SARS-CoV infected mice after depletion of airway CD8 + T cells. n=3 mice/group/time point. ∗ P<0.05. Data are representative of two independent experiments. The figure was adapted with permission from ref. 45. Copyright © 2016 Elsevier.
